snippet: Two people have asked that their convictions in the killing of a Bronx cabdriver be lifted, arguing that two others had confessed.
abstract: Prosecutors decline to support a request that a court immediately vacate the convictions of Eric Glisson and Cathy Watkins in the robbery and fatal shooting of livery-cab driver Baithe Diop in 1995; Bronx district attorney's office says it has been unable to substantiate information forming the crux of the defendants' arguments of wrongful convictions.
lead_paragraph: Two people have asked that their convictions in the killing of a Bronx cabdriver be lifted, arguing that two others had confessed.

headline.seo: Court Hearing Sought on Innocence Claim in ’95 Bronx Killing
